intro: Gynandropsis sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is shrub-like, with small, narrow leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Its flowers are typically yellow and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. It is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
